file.doc: Path to the file for the datasource

base.doc: A base path used to complete a full path to a file.
base.default-meaning: Only the `file` option will be used to attempt to load data from the filesystem

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

row_limit.doc: Max amount of features to read from the datasource
row_limit.default-meaning: All features will be read from the datasource (unless row_limit is > 1)

strict.doc: Control if the datasource should throw on invalid rows
strict.default-meaning: Unless this option is set to true the datasource will skip invalid rows and attempt to parse as much data as possible

escape.doc: The escape character to use for parsing data
escape.default-meaning: A backslash will be used as the assumed character that the data uses for escaping other characters

quote.doc: The quote character to use for parsing data
quote.default-meaning: A backslash will be used as the assumed character that the data uses for escaping other characters

separator.doc: The separator character to use for parsing data
separator.default-value: Basic autodetection is used to determine the best default value if the user does not manually supply a separator.
separator.default-meaning: A comma will be used unless more tabs (	), pipes (|), or semicolons (;) are detected than commas in the header row (in that order of preference)

headers.doc: A comma separated list of header names that can be set to add headers to data that lacks them
headers.default-meaning: Headers will be parsed from the first line of the data unless this option is set

filesize_max.doc: The maximum filesize in MB that will be accepted
filesize_max.default-meaning: A file that is larger that 20 MB will not be accepted and an error will be throw unless the user manually passes this option with a larger value (useful only in cases where your machine has a lot of memory)

file.doc: Path to the file for the datasource

base.doc: A base path used to complete a full path to a file.
base.default-meaning: Only the `file` option will be used to attempt to load data from the filesystem

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

file.doc: Path to the file for the datasource

base.doc: A base path used to complete a full path to a file.
base.default-meaning: Only the `file` option will be used to attempt to load data from the filesystem

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

inline.doc: Raw tabular data to be read instead of reading data from a file
inline.default-meaning: Unless this option is provided data will be read from the `file` option

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

file.doc: Path to the file for the datasource

base.doc: A base path used to complete a full path to a file.
base.default-meaning: Only the `file` option will be used to attempt to load data from the filesystem

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

file.doc: Path to the file for the datasource

base.doc: A base path used to complete a full path to a file.
base.default-meaning: Only the `file` option will be used to attempt to load data from the filesystem

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

key_field.doc: User provided field name to interpret as the primary key of the table. If provided then the values from this field (which must be an integer) will be used as the feature id of the returned data
key_field.default-meaning: By default no primary key is required and in this case the feature id for returned features will be auto-generated by Mapnik and is not certain to be globally unique.

key_field_as_attribute.doc: User provided option to control whether the key_field will be duplicated as a feature attribute (as well as being used for the feature.id value)
key_field_as_attribute.default-meaning: By default if key_field is provided then it is also available in the feature attributes by field name

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

dbname.default-meaning: Will default to a database named after the user (as per libpq defaults)

extent.doc: A comma or space delimited bounding box in the format of minx,miny,maxx,maxy that, if provided, will be used to report the extent of the datasource. The primary reason the option exists is for performance: providing this option at datasource creation saves the time otherwise needed to scan the data for the actual extent, which for large datasets can be very significant. The datasource extent, whether manually provided or automatically calculated is used during rendering to decide if the datasource should be queried for features or not (skipped for best performance). If the extent intersects with the map rendering extent then the datasource will be queried and the query extent will be clipped to the reported datasource extent. So, this means that this option can also be used to restrict which features are available for a given datasource
extent.default-meaning: The datasource extent will be determined at runtime by querying the data, which may be slow, although the extent only needs to be determined once per datasource initialized and it will be cached for further rendering

estimate_extent.doc: If an `extent` string is not provided then Mapnik dynamically queries the table to determine the extent. If this option is true then the faster but less accurate PostGIS `ST_EstimatedExtent` function is used instead of `ST_Extent`.

geometry_table.doc: Specifies geometry table to use to look up metadata

cursor_size.doc: Integer size of binary cursor to use

row_limit.doc: Max amount of features to read from the datasource
row_limit.default-meaning: All features will be read from the datasource (unless row_limit is > 1)

autodetect_key_field.doc: Attempt to autodetect a primary key field
autodetect_key_field.default-meaning: Don't autodetect a primary key field

persist_connection.default-meaning: Connections, successfully created, will be kept open until Mapnik shuts down

extent_from_subquery.doc: Direct Mapnik to query Postgis for the extent of the raw 'table' value

encoding.doc: The encoding value for the datasource attributes
encoding.default-meaning: UTF8 will be the assumed encoding for string attribute values

file.doc: Path to the file for the datasource

base.doc: A base path used to complete a full path to a file.
base.default-meaning: Only the `file` option will be used to attempt to load data from the filesystem
